---
title: "Course overview"
---

This class is an introduction to data science explored through the lens of contemporary economic and social justice issues.
You will learn to manipulate, visualize, and analyze data for the purpose of understanding societal phenomena and patterns that impact the lives of people in the United States, particularly those coming from historically marginalized groups.
You will also learn to effectively communicate data science topics by researching, writing, and presenting on real-world problems, using data throughout the process to support your findings.

This courses uses the R statistical programming language to teach key data science tasks like wrangling, visualization, and exploratory data analysis.
No prior experience with statistics or programming is necessary for this course, and it has no prerequisites in the Davidson College course catalog.

## Class meetings

This class meets every Tuesday and Thursday from 08:15 to 09:30 in Watson 132.
